[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Enum variant tags] When JWKMoveStruct variant is serialized, is the enum tag correctly encoded, or can tag manipulation cause the wrong variant to be deserialized? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Trailing data] If BCS-serialized PatchUpsertJWK contains trailing bytes after the struct data, are they ignored or do they cause deserialization to fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Version compatibility] If the BCS format version changes between Rust and Move, can PatchUpsertJWK instances serialized with one version fail to deserialize with another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Serialization] [Canonical encoding] Does BCS enforce canonical encoding for PatchUpsertJWK, or can multiple valid encodings of the same data cause hash mismatches in state verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Resource] [File descriptor exhaustion] Can creating many PatchUpsertJWK instances exhaust file descriptors or other system resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Key substitution] Can an attacker create a PatchUpsertJWK with a malicious JWK that matches the key ID of a legitimate key but has different cryptographic parameters? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Weak key injection] Can PatchUpsertJWK be used to inject cryptographically weak RSA keys (e.g., small modulus, weak exponent) into the system? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Key rotation timing] During JWK rotation via PatchUpsertJWK, can timing attacks observe the window when both old and new keys are valid? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Crypto] [Unsupported variant abuse] Can an attacker use PatchUpsertJWK to insert UnsupportedJWK variants that appear valid but can't actually verify signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [State] [Determinism] Are PatchUpsertJWK conversions fully deterministic across all validators, or can subtle differences (e.g., timestamp, random ordering) cause state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [State] [Partial application] If apply_patch() partially succeeds when processing a PatchUpsertJWK, can this leave the JWK set in an inconsistent state? (Critical)
